poem:
**Dugnadsånd**

Amidst slippers and buns,  
a call to bare hands—  
a new embrace.  
Not as sweet or tidy;  
yet homes flicker with  
the warmth of shared toil.  
Beyond cinnamon comfort,  
our hands reshape hearths,  
where deeds whisper louder  
than autumn's soft grace,  
where the spirit builds  
of simple, earnest kindness.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "It’s time to embrace Dugnadsånd – the Norwegian concept we all need right now | Emma Beddington A new hygge has dropped, but you’ll need to take off your cosy slippers and put down your cinnamon bun to try it. There is a real danger of getting the wrong end of the stick when we get enthusiastic about other nations’ lifestyles – such as when the New York Times writes about modern Britons enjoying boiled". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
